p.seg: Il n'y eut personne pour critiquer leur tenue, [§§§§§§§服"sartorial style" is the point here, the people not objecting to any of the ancient ruler's dress style. The English misses the point of the argument.]

tous embrassant leur vertu. [§§德 is probably specifically "munificence". 陳廣忠 also takes 德 as the ruler's "virtuous generosity" which makes more sense than the mechanical renderings of the English and French which do have the advantage of retaining a consistent version for de：而共同含怀他们的德泽]

le yin et le yang étaient dans un équilibre harmonieux, [§和平 is one binome, not two words. 陰陽"the (potential conflicting) cosmic energies of Yin and Yang" are what is really referred to here, not Yin and Yang themselves, I think. 許匡一 has the subtle point precisely: 在那时候，阴气、阳气平平和和.]
When a talented person undertakes a light task
then he will become famous;
and when a good-for-nothing undertakes a big task
and when a good-for-nothing undertakes a big task (DS: for a good-for nothing, his task is important)
Mengzi se dostavil k slyšení u liangského krále Huie.
Velmožové si řeknou:
Svobodní muži i prostí lidé si řeknou:
velmožové si řeknou:
"Moudří a nadaní v tomto také nacházejí zalíbení?"
"Až ten, kdo je moudrý a nadaný, v tom nalezne skutečné zalíbení.
Ti nemoudří, byť by to měli, v tom věru zalíbení nenajdou.
prostý lid se dostavil jako [poslušné] děti.
Laním se leskla srst
Král Wen použil [pracovní] sílu lidu ke zbudování terasy a jezera,
ale lid se tomu radoval,
Oni jenom neudělali sto kroků, a nic víc.
Sekyry pouštějte do lesů pouze ve správný čas a dřevo nepůjde všechno spotřebovat.
dosáhnete tím, že se lid bude starat o živé a truchlit za mrtvé bez zášti.
Jak by se stavěl k tomu,
King Huì4 of Liáng said:
potom výhonky zprudka ožijí.
and ofered the delicacies of the liver, lungs, head, and heart,
Legge: When contentions about territory
When some struggle for a city is the ground for a fight
This is called leading on the land
This is called leading on the land to devour human flesh,
death is not enough for such a crime. Legge
Legge: When contentions about territory are the ground on which they fight,
LEGGE'S TRANSLATION INSERTED HERE: When contentions about territory are the ground on which they fight,
death is not enough for such a crime. Legge insertion finishes here.
Translation must be added.
How much more would they have rejected those who are vehement to fight for their prince

Han Feizi's "Solitary Indignation," and Zhang Yi's and Su Qin's "Horizontal and Vertical" [Alliance System]
kde laně vrhly [svá] mláďata.
'Kdy toto Slunce (= Jie) zajde?
byť by [Jie] měl terasy, jezera, ptáky a zvěř,
což byl schopen se z toto těšit samojediný?"
JÖWA · FIFTH YEAR SIXTH MOON: 13th DAY 1 At noon the embassy board­ed the first and fourth ships, but because we did not have a favorable wind, we waited for three days.
JŌWA · FIFTH YEAR but because we did not have a favorable wind, we waited for three days.
we waited for three days

17th DAYIn the middle of the night, profiting from a stiff wind, we hoisted sail and set the ships in motion. At 10 A. l\L n-e reached the sea east of Shiganoshima.2 Because we did not have reliable winds, we stopped for five days.

17th DAY. In the middle of the night, profiting from a stiff wind, we hoisted sail and set the ships in motion. At 10 A. l\L n-e reached the sea east of Shiganoshima.2 Because we did not have reliable winds, we stopped for five days.
At 10 A. l\L n-e reached the sea east of Shiganoshima.2 Because we did not have reliable winds, we stopped for five days.
and on into the night we went in the dark
and the
and the Scholar and Student Monks ; together read scriptures and prayed.

At 10 P. M. [the shipsJ were in contact by fire signals, which were like stars in appearance, but when dawn came [the fourth ship] was not to be seen. Although there had been a shift of the wind from the northeast to the southeast, we were not afraid of drifting from the course. Great bamboos,
Although there had been a shift of the wind from the northeast to the southeast,
Great bamboos,

27th DAY The "flat irons " 9 were struck by a wave and all feil off. Exhausted [ egrets ]10 settled down [ on the ship] for the night and did not leave. Two or three would fly off to the west and then again retum and perch. They did this several times. The sea is whitish green. All night men were ordered to mount the mast to look for mountains or islands, and they would always 10• call out that they saw none. 28th DAY Early in the morning the egrets flew off in pairs toward the northwest. Since the wind was still un­changed, we trimmed sail and headed southwest. At 10 A. :.\L we reached whitish water, the color of which was like yellow mud. The men all said thnt this perhaps was water flowing from the Great River of Y nng-chou.11 They had a man

27th DAY. The "flat irons" were struck by a wave and all fell off. Exhausted [ egrets ]10 settled down [ on the ship] for the night and did not leave. Two or three would fly off to the west and then again retum and perch. They did this several times. The sea is whitish green. All night men were ordered to mount the mast to look for mountains or islands, and they would always 10• call out that they saw none. 28th DAY Early in the morning the egrets flew off in pairs toward the northwest. Since the wind was still un­changed, we trimmed sail and headed southwest. At 10 A. :.\L we reached whitish water, the color of which was like yellow mud. The men all said thnt this perhaps was water flowing from the Great River of Y nng-chou.11 They had a man

M. we reached whitish water, the color of which was like yellow mud. The men all said that this perhaps was water flowing from the Great River of Yang-chou. They had a man

28th DAY. Early in the morning the egrets flew off in pairs toward the northwest. Since the wind was still un­changed, we trimmed sail and headed southwest. At 10 A. M. we reached whitish water, the color of which was like yellow mud. The men all said that this perhaps was water flowing from the Great River of Yang-chou. They had a man
They had a man

that [the whitish water] flowed from the northwest 12 directly toward the south and that its width was over twenty li but that when one looked far along the way ahead the water again became light green. After we had proceeded for a short time, it turned out just as he bad said. The Ambassador was greatly surprised that the color of the sea again became light green. The Korean lnterpreter,18 Kirn Chongnam 1€1Em, stated that he had heard it said u that it was difficult to pass through the dug channel of Yang-chou 10 and that, since we bad already passed the whitish water, he suspected that we may have passed by the dug channel.

"Warum veranlasst Eure Majestät nicht jemanden, zu Gōngshu von Hán zu sagen:
ist, dass sie den Östlichen Zhou vertrauen.'
ist, dass es den Östlichen Zhou vertraut.'

ist, dass er [dem Fürsten der] Östlichen Zhōu vertraut.'

What is the object governed by 見?

What is the object governed by 見? Is it the "whitish water" (白水) referred to above? Or is the sentence ungrammatical as it stands? If yes, would 見 have to be substituted by wàng 望, "gaze into the distance"?
According to Cbeta,

A girl is out on a stroll, expecting to be courted by some young gentleman. She is however disappointed, having seen only a youngster whom she does not appreciate. The fact that she calls him on the one hand "a foolish fellow", on the other hand "a crafty youth" suggests that he did not wish or dare to make any advances, but held cautiously ("craftily") aloof. This is confirmed by ode 86 below, where we have a very analogous theme. A cognate theme also in ode 87.
and so I think of the vaulted Blue.
